poem:
### The Faces of Union

In halls of power, shadows entwine,  
Leaders speak with silken tongues,  
Voices whisper across the divide—  
Together, yet alone.  
  
From the east, a prayer for strength,  
In alliance not of walls, but will;  
Echoes of unity or fractured path,  
Europe dreams in paradox still.
